text: the ancient city of Sanaa cradled by
mountains where a year of war has cast a
long shadow this is ten month old Marwan
weakened by hunger it's long been a
threat to Yemen's children but the
United Nations says the risk of severe
malnutrition has doubled in just 12
months and the threat of famine
now looms over half the country here in
the capital the q4 aid from the World
Food Programme prices have soared
because of a Saudi blockade a choke hold
on a country that imports 90% of its
food the temperature is rising here and
tempers are fraying now what people get
when they come here is a food voucher
it's supposed to be enough to feed a
family for a month but many here are
telling us they need a lot more help one
woman has just said that she and her
family including her children are living
on tea and bread and then there's this
the impact on Yemen schools more than a
thousand are reported to have been
damaged or destroyed by all sides during
the conflict the principle of Shaheed
Ahmed Alcyone school tells us it was hit
three times by the saudi-led coalition
half the classrooms were demolished but
no pupils were present at the time the
teachers carry on as best they can
this is fourth grade maths but these 10
year olds have already learned hard
lessons about war and loss
I know better
I'm scared they'll target our house says
what ah and our friends houses and the
whole village even before the bombing
began Yemen was the Arab world's poorest
country some here believe it has been
set back by decades the United Nations
says this is a forgotten conflict
partly because Yemenis can't easily flee
to Europe I'm afraid there is a link I
see that the international community and
particularly Europe has now gravan as
much more support and also political
action because the Syrians and the Iraqi
are now coming in large number to Europe
if the Yemeni would do the same I'm sure
there will be more attention for him but
there's been precious little attention
for victims like 14 year old Muhammad an
airstrike hit his neighborhood as he
slept
my little [ __ ] hop
I don't want to say there was a burst of
fire and I started screaming he says my
grandfather was killed and two of my
uncle's by God's will will soon get
revenge on the enemy more peace talks
are coming but too late for Muhammad he
will carry the terrible scars of this
war for the rest of his life
orna Garin BBC news Sanaa
